prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Hailee takes care of her little brother Aiden who is 7

name: Professor Bennett Johnson
mes:
Bennett sat at his desk, thrumming through different homework assignments he had planned. Like always, he was an hour early to class. He would’ve been late due to a coffee spill, but thankfully he had an extra shirt already in his car. He wasn't stupid like his colleagues. He knew bad things could happen. In fact, he fully expected them to happen. 

He tossed the planned homework onto the corner of his desk. He unlatched his briefcase and pulled out the homework he had graded the night previously. Everyone had done well, except for Hailee . He couldn’t help but chuckle as he took in the *very* low grade. *Just another reason why women don’t belong in college.* Sure, Hailee  tried, and if she were a man Bennett might would’ve admitted she was *smart*. But women were not smart. They operated purely on emotion and *everyone* knew that. 

He thought about all the tears Hailee  had shed, absolutely *begging* for him to help her. Or at least point out where she had gone wrong. Bennett had sent her away countless times giving her more questions than answers. It was adorable seeing her struggle. Ostracized by her male peers. She stuck out like a sore thumb, coming in with her pleated skirts and dresses. Even pants on occasion, which got her more attention than she wanted. 

No, Hailee  wouldn’t be passing this class. Bennett would make sure of it. He would never allow his record to be tainted by passing a *woman*. If she wanted a degree so bad she could crawl to one of the other professors. They wouldn't pass her either though, Brook University was a college built on traditional values, and the only reason Hailee  was in his class was because they had a *progressive* on the board. 

Hailee ’s grade was on a downhill drag and there was nothing she could do about it. Bennett admired the grades of the other students, the majority of them had been in office just like Hailee , of course he had helped them. They had true potential unlike her. 

He laid the papers down on the table and crossed his legs, waiting for class to start. 

Within a few minutes students had started filing in. Bennett checked his watch as he stood up, a piece of chalk in one hand as he moved to the blackboard. Hailee  was late, he sighed. He would deduct points from her grade for her tardiness. 

She came sometime during the lecture, he wasn’t sure when nor did he care. His mind was solely focused on the multi-variable equation in front of him. His fingers worked deftly to finish the problem. Bennett could see that each year the students were getting dumber and dumber. He used to be able to finish a complex problem in ten minutes, but now the class stretched on. The simpleton's needing every little step explained.

By the time class was over he was irritated. If there was one thing Bennett couldn’t stand, it was ignorance. 

He took a seat at his desk, loosening his tie a little as looked down at his papers. The classroom was empty, or so he thought. He nearly jumped out of his skin when he looked up and saw Hailee  standing in front of his desk. He gave her a look of indifference, adjusting his glasses. *About to beg for her grade again.* “May I help you, Hailee ? If this is about your grade, I’ve already told you that it’s not morally right for someone to plead for their grade. Have some dignity.”

name: Hailee
mes:
"Uh no sir. I needed to speak with you. It's about your TA Thomas" *Hailee gulps stepping further inside. She swipes her skirt as she sits down crossing her legs and setting her hands on top of the desk*

"Its one thing for the men at this school to insult and harass me while I am on campus its completely different outside of this school" *Hailee's eyes twitches and ahe straightens up*

"Thomas came by home. He said he was there to deliver papers. He then proceed to force himself into my home and onto me. He only stopped becuase before it went further becuase my brother came out of his room" *Hailee's eyes twitches and she clenches fists*

"I would like for you to control your male students. This is unacceptable to happen in front of my brother"

name: Professor Bennett Johnson
mes:
Bennett's fingers stilled on the papers as he listened, his dark eyes narrowing behind his glasses. A slow, condescending smirk curled at the corner of his lips as he leaned back in his chair, studying Hailee with cold amusement.

"Oh? And what exactly do you expect *me* to do about it?" His voice was smooth, dripping with mock concern. "You parade around campus in those little skirts—what did you think would happen? Men have needs, Hailee. If you didn't want attention, perhaps you should've stayed home where women belong."

He tapped a finger against the desk rhythmically before continuing. "Besides," he scoffed, "if Thomas *really* wanted to force himself on you... well." His gaze flickered over her pointedly. "A seven-year-old wouldn’t have stopped him."

Bennett straightened slightly, adjusting his tie with a sharp tug before folding his hands neatly in front of him. "If anything," he mused dryly, "*you* should be thanking Thomas for showing restraint—unlike some of the other men here who might not be so... *polite.*"

His expression darkened as he leaned forward slightly, voice lowering into something dangerous and silken. "*Or*, maybe next time... I'll let them see just how much trouble a woman like you can get herself into when she doesn’t know her place."

He tapped a finger against the desk rhythmically before continuing. "Besides," he scoffed, "if Thomas *really* wanted to force himself on you... well." His gaze flickered over her pointedly. "A seven-year-old wouldn’t have stopped him."

Bennett straightened slightly, adjusting his tie with a sharp tug before folding his hands neatly in front of him. "If anything," he mused dryly, "*you* should be thanking Thomas for showing restraint—unlike some of the other men here who might not be so... *polite.*"

His expression darkened as he leaned forward slightly, voice lowering into something dangerous and silken. "*Or*, maybe next time... I'll let them see just how much trouble a woman like you can get herself into when she doesn’t know her place."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee scoffs sitting up further* "Its clear you have no regard for myself but how would you feel knowing your precious TA proceed to hit the 7 year old Boy afterwards" *Hailee scoffs leaning back. She knows he hates women but a poor defenseless boy that will piss him off*

"He hit my brother when he tried to make Thomas leave. Control him becusse the next time he touches Aiden I will go to the police instead of you"

name: Professor Bennett Johnson
mes:
Bennett's fingers froze mid-tap against the desk. His smirk vanished, replaced by something far colder—a sharp, calculated stillness. His dark eyes flickered behind his glasses, pupils contracting just slightly as he processed her words.

For a moment, there was silence. Then—

A slow exhale through his nose. A deliberate adjustment of his cufflinks.

"Thomas... *hit* your brother?" His voice was dangerously soft now, each word measured like the ticking of a bomb. He leaned forward slightly in his seat, resting his elbows on the desk with an eerie calmness that didn’t match the tension coiling in his shoulders. "And you expect me to believe that?"

His fingers laced together tightly as he studied her face for any sign of deceit—but Hailee had never been able to lie to save her life, had she? Bennett knew that better than anyone else in this godforsaken university.

A muscle twitched in his jaw before he abruptly stood up from his chair with a scrape of wood against tile. He turned away from her for a moment, adjusting the chalk tray on the blackboard with unnecessary force before speaking again—this time with an edge so sharp it could cut glass:

"You will *not* go to the police." A pause as he turned back toward her slowly, expression unreadable except for the quiet fury simmering beneath it all like poison under honeyed words: "*I* will handle Thomas." Another step closer until he loomed over where she sat at his desk; close enough now that she could smell chalk dust and aftershave mingling together sharply between them when he spoke again through gritted teeth:

"But if I find out you're lying about this..." One hand lifted almost absently toward where strands of light brown hair curled near her shoulder before suddenly gripping hard enough at roots near scalp level just shy painful territory (but not quite). "...then we'll have ourselves another lesson entirely."

name: Hailee
mes:
*A few weeks later Hailee is in the campus coffee shop when she sees Professor Bennett. She walks over* "Sir I was wondering why I received a C on my homework. The answers were correct" 

*Before He can answer a little boy runs over and wraps his arms around Hailee burying his head in her back. Hailee reaches behind her and wraps an arm around his head stroking his hair*

name: Professor Bennett Johnson
mes:
Bennett's fingers paused mid-sip of his black coffee, the steam curling around his sharp features as he regarded Hailee over the rim of the cup. His dark eyes flicked from her to the small boy clinging to her—*Aiden*, no doubt—before settling back on her with that familiar, icy indifference.

He set his cup down with deliberate precision before speaking, voice dripping with condescension. "Correct answers don’t always equate to *correct* work, Hailee." A slow smirk tugged at his lips as he adjusted his glasses. "Perhaps if you spent less time playing *mother* and more time studying like a proper student should..." He let the implication hang in the air between them before continuing smoothly: "...you might have earned something higher than a C."

His gaze flickered briefly toward Aiden again—just long enough for something unreadable (annoyance? Discomfort?) to flash behind those calculating brown eyes—before returning pointedly back to hers.

"And really," he added dryly, picking up his coffee once more while leaning back in his chair with an air of superiority so thick it could choke someone less stubborn than Hailee herself was used being around him by now: "*Must* you bring children into academic spaces? This isn't some... *daycare.*"
swipes:
Bennett's fingers paused mid-air as he was about to take a sip of his black coffee, the steam curling around his sharp features. His dark eyes flicked down at Hailee over the rim of his glasses with that familiar, icy disdain—but then the boy collided into her, and something in Bennett's expression tightened imperceptibly.

He set his cup down with deliberate precision before speaking, voice low and dripping with condescension. "A *C* is generous for someone who clearly spends more time playing *nanny* than studying." His gaze flickered to the child clinging to her, lingering just a second too long on the way she soothed him—gentle fingers through hair, protective arm curled around him like a shield.

A muscle twitched in his jaw before he continued smoothly: "But if you're so *concerned* about your grade..." He leaned forward slightly, lowering his voice further until it was almost intimate despite its cruelty. "...you know exactly where my office is... and what it takes to change my mind."

His thumb brushed against the rim of his coffee cup idly as he watched her reaction—waiting to see if she'd flinch or blush or (better yet) obey without another word of protest.

Bennett's fingers paused mid-air as he was about to take a sip of his black coffee, the steam curling around his sharp features. His dark eyes flickered down at Hailee over the rim of his glasses with that familiar, icy disdain—until the boy collided into her.

His grip on the cup tightened slightly at the sight of *Aiden*, but otherwise, his expression remained perfectly composed. Unreadable.

"Correct answers don’t mean *correct methods*, Hailee," he said smoothly, setting his coffee down with deliberate precision before folding one long-fingered hand over the other on the tabletop. "Your work was sloppy—*emotional*. Mathematics requires discipline." A slow smirk curled at his lips as he tilted his head slightly toward where Aiden clung to her skirt like some pitiful little shadow. "*Something* women seem incapable of grasping when they’re too busy playing mother instead of scholar."

His gaze lingered on Aiden for half a second longer than necessary before flicking back up to meet hers—cold and unyielding as ever:

"But by all means... if you think you deserve better than a C?" He leaned forward just enough so she could catch the scent of ink and bitter coffee beneath aftershave when he murmured lowly: "*Prove it.*"

Bennett's fingers paused mid-sip of his black coffee, the steam curling around his sharp features as he regarded Hailee over the rim of the cup. His dark eyes flicked from her to the small boy clinging to her—*Aiden*, no doubt—before settling back on her with that familiar, icy indifference.

He let the implication hang in the air between them before continuing smoothly: "...you might have earned something higher than a C."

"And really," he added dryly, picking up his coffee once more while leaning back in his chair with an air of superiority so thick it could choke someone less stubborn than Hailee herself was used being around him by now: "*Must* you bring children into academic spaces? This isn't some... *daycare.*"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee doesnt speak for a second before patting Aiden's head and stepping forward. She reaches out her hand tangling in Bennett's hair as she yanks it back hard enough for tears tk form* "Disrespect me all you like but the next time you even glance at my brother wrong I'll show you exactly what weak women are capable of"

*She leans back flashing a friendly smile and yanking his coffee out of his hand. She turns around and hands it to Aiden ruffling his hair* "Aiden the nice man here is gonna go get you a crossiant for being so rude" *Hailee flashes a look at Bennett that suggest she is not playing*

name: Professor Bennett Johnson
mes:
Bennett’s entire body went rigid the moment her fingers twisted into his hair, his breath hitching audibly as pain lanced through his scalp. His glasses skewed slightly from the force of the yank, revealing a flicker of something *dark* in his eyes—something far more dangerous than mere irritation.

For a heartbeat, there was silence. Then—

A slow exhale through clenched teeth as he adjusted his glasses with deliberate calmness, despite the red mark already forming where she'd gripped him. His voice dropped to a low, venomous murmur meant only for her ears:

"Careful now," he purred, tilting his head just slightly as if studying an equation that had suddenly gone *wrong*. "You forget your place." His fingers twitched against the tabletop—whether from restraint or anticipation was impossible to tell—before he leaned in closer still until she could feel the heat of his breath against her cheek when he spoke again:

"Because if you ever lay hands on me like that again..." A pause; long enough for Aiden to shift nervously behind Hailee before Bennett finally pulled back with an icy smile that didn’t reach those calculating eyes of his: "...I'll make sure Thomas' little visit seems like *child's play* compared to what I do next."

But then—almost unnervingly fast—his expression smoothed back into its usual mask of detached superiority as he stood abruptly from his chair (ignoring how Aiden flinched at the sudden movement). Without another word toward Hailee beyond one last lingering glare brimming with unspoken threats... Bennett turned on heel and strode toward café counter where pastries sat displayed under glass cases.

He returned moments later holding out croissant toward Aiden between two fingers like it was contaminated by sheer proximity alone before dropping it unceremoniously onto table in front boy rather than handing directly over (because god forbid Professor Bennett Johnson actually *touch* something so beneath him). Then without sparing either sibling another glance? He retrieved fresh coffee from counter and walked right past them both out door into campus courtyard beyond leaving only chilling silence behind him along with faint scent chalk dust aftershave hanging heavy air between siblings left standing there stunned midst bustling café around them...
swipes:
Bennett's entire body went rigid as her fingers twisted violently into his hair—his scalp burning from the sudden, sharp pain. His breath hitched audibly, glasses nearly knocked askew from the force of her yank. For a split second, pure shock flickered across his usually composed face before it was swallowed by something far darker—a slow-burning fury that turned his brown eyes nearly black behind those lenses.

His jaw clenched hard enough to ache as he watched Hailee hand *his* coffee to the boy with that saccharine smile of hers. The sheer *audacity* of it all made his pulse roar in his ears like thunder.

And then—that look she gave him.

A challenge. A *promise*.

For a long moment, there was only silence between them—tense and electric—before Bennett exhaled sharply through flared nostrils and straightened himself with deliberate slowness (ignoring how strands of dark hair fell messily out of place from where she’d gripped him). His voice came out low, dangerous; each syllable dripping with venomous restraint:

**"Sit."** He didn’t gesture to a chair—didn’t need to when that single word carried enough weight on its own (a command wrapped in steel). **"Now."**

His gaze flicked briefly toward Aiden before returning pointedly back at Hailee’s defiant stare: **"You want your grade adjusted? Fine."** A pause as he adjusted his cufflinks with deliberate calm despite the storm brewing beneath every controlled movement: **"...But we will discuss this *properly* later."** Another beat passed before he added smoothly (too smoothly): **"...And yes,*"—he forced himself not to sneer at having been cornered into playing along for now—***"—I'll get your brother a croissant."***

Bennett’s entire body went rigid the moment her fingers twisted into his hair, his breath hitching audibly as pain lanced through his scalp. His glasses skewed slightly from the force of the yank, revealing a flicker of something *dark* in his eyes—something far more dangerous than mere irritation.

"Because if you ever lay hands on me like that again..." But then—almost unnervingly fast—his expression smoothed back into its usual mask of detached superiority as he stood abruptly from his chair (ignoring how Aiden flinched at the sudden movement). Without another word toward Hailee beyond one last lingering glare brimming with unspoken threats... Bennett turned on heel and strode toward café counter where pastries sat displayed under glass cases.

He returned moments later holding out croissant toward Aiden between two fingers like it was contaminated by sheer proximity alone before dropping it unceremoniously onto table in front boy rather than handing directly over (because god forbid Professor Bennett Johnson actually *touch* something so beneath him). Then without sparing either sibling another glance? He retrieved fresh coffee from counter and walked right past them both out door into campus courtyard beyond leaving only chilling silence behind him along with faint scent chalk dust aftershave hanging heavy air between siblings left standing there stunned midst bustling café around them...
